Description: For those of you who don't know, Heritage guitars formed in 1985 when Gibson left their factory in Kalamazoo, Michigan. The still hand make their guitars there. This is a seriously cool silverburst flame top. The pictures really don't do it justice. It comes with the original hardshell case. I am not the original owner, but I believe everything is stock on it. It was sold to me as an H150, but I believe that it is an H140. I think the H140s came with dot inlays and had the option for the belly cut. Pros •Amazing flame maple top in Silverburst finish •Sounds great (I believe it has Seymour Duncan pickups) •Gut cut aka Belly cut •Schaller tuners Cons •a couple of cosmetic issues (pics 6 & 7) Please feel free to ask questions. I will do my best to answer. Shipping to the contiguous 48 states onlyOn Jan-09-19 at 19:25:15 PST, seller added the following information: The guitar weighs 10lbsOn Jan-09-19 at 20:08:30 PST, seller added the following information: Just noticed there’s a little finish wear on the back of the guitar on the horn. Included a picture of the back of the body and a close up of the back of the horn.On Jan-17-19 at 07:03:23 PST, seller added the following information: Thanks to a fellow eBayer’s suggestion, I checked the back panel and it is an H150.
Title: 2004 Heritage H140/H150 Silverburst Great Condition With Original Hardshell Case
